UC Riverside Is for Veterans
Take your place at one of the most highly ranked and respected universities in the world. UCR's diverse campus will welcome you. Our community of over 800 veteran and military-connected students will support you, and our knowledge of state and federal resources will assist you. We are here for you — from application through graduation. 
No wonder UCR was ranked as a GOLD campus by VIQTORY (publisher of G.I. Jobs Magazine).  The ranking is a Military Friendly Schools designation.
Welcome home to UCR!









Get UCR in Your Inbox









Go To:


Student Disability Resource Center

Academic Calendar

Veterans Resource Center

Career Center - Operation VETS









Here for You, Always
Student Affairs is here to support you throughout the pandemic.
Connect





















Attainability
Getting a UC degree is within your reach! Course and GPA requirements for UCR and many of the majors are a lot more attainable than you may realize. With over 80 desirable majors, distinguished faculty, groundbreaking research, and successful graduates, UCR has for the fourth consecutive year been named as U.S. News & World Report's #1 public university in the nation for social mobility.
Explore Admissions 



Affordability
Thanks to available benefits, scholarships, and grants, most student veterans pay little or nothing out of pocket to attend UCR. Our Financial Aid Veterans Affairs School Certifying Officials (VASCO) will help you work with the VA to get all the education benefits for which you’re eligible. No wonder UCR is ranked as one of the best colleges for your money. (Money Magazine, 2020)
Explore Cost 


        
Community
We understand that transitioning from military to university life can be challenging. Fortunately, UCR’s Veterans Resource Center (VRC) is a welcoming place for student veterans to gather, study, and just hang out. Grab a free cup of coffee or snack from the fridge. Take advantage of the study lab and free printer services. Find peer support, connect to resources, and more!
Explore the VRC



Support
UCR is committed to helping each student thrive and fully participate in all aspects of campus life. Resources like Student Health Services, Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS), and Student Disability Resource Center (SDRC) are here to help you reduce barriers that can interfere with your academic success and enjoyment of campus life.
Explore Support






















 






UCR Is a Yellow Ribbon Campus!
The university and the VA split the non-resident tuition costs for Post-9/11 GI Bill® recipients with 100% eligibility. That means at UCR, out-of-state veterans pay the same, lower tuition rate as California residents!
Please note: GI Bill® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). More information about education benefits offered by VA is available at the official U.S. government Web site at http://www.benefits.va.gov/gibill.





 





















“I am so grateful for the VRC — it's become my home on campus. It's nice to have a place to hang out or study in between classes. Plus, I've learned so much about my benefits and the campus through the workshops they host.”
Jennifer Sayre
U.S. Army Veteran
History and Education Double-Major

Campus Security and Fire Safety Report
The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act) requires UCR (as an institution of higher education receiving federal financial aid) to report specified crime statistics on college campuses and to provide other safety and crime information to all current and prospective students and employees. The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is available on the Chief Compliance Office website. If you would like a paper copy of the Report, you may contact the Clery Coordinator via email at clery@ucr.edu or by phone at (951) 827-6223.
